page.title: 14BUILDINGS IN STURTON
page.content: THE{OLDEST BUILDING}IN STURTON WAS BUILT IN{178O}IN BRICK AND TIMBER, ORIGINALLY WITH A THATCHED ROOF. THERE ARE SEVERAL TYPICAL{LINCOLNSHIRE {COTTAGES (RED BRICK AND PANTILE {ROOFED),}MANY BUILT WITH LOCALLY MADE BRICKS. THE{CHURCH OF ST.HUGH OF {AVALON (1879)}IS BUILT IN BRICK AND IS QUITE HUMBLE. IT HAS 13TH CENTURY STYLE WINDOWS AND A BELLCOTE. THE CHURCH, TOGETHER WITH ITS LYCH GATE,IS {GRADE 11 LISTED.}ALSO LISTED ARE {BRICKYARD COTTAGES,THE OLD HALL}AND {SUBSCRIPTION MILL,}A WINDMILL BUILT IN 18O1 WITH SUBSCRIPTIONS FROM LOCAL FARMERS TO GRIND THEIR OWN CORN. THE OUTER SHELL HAS BEEN RESTORED,BUT NOW HAS A FIBRE- GLASS TOP. THE ORIGINAL TOP AND WORKINGS HAVE BEEN USED TO RESTORE A WORKING MILL IN LINCOLN.
